body:
Torque-level wrapper front-ends that invoke runtime tier-up and assembly stubs for JS↔Wasm wrappers.
- Files: src/builtins/js-to-wasm.tq, src/builtins/wasm-to-js.tq, builtins-definitions.h anchors
- Key symbols:
  - js-to-wasm.tq:
    • extern runtime TierUpJSToWasmWrapper(NoContext, WasmExportedFunctionData)
    • extern builtin JSToWasmWrapperAsm(RawPtr<intptr>, WasmImportData|WasmTrustedInstanceData, JSAny): JSAny
    • extern builtin WasmReturnPromiseOnSuspendAsm(...)
    • macro JSToWasmWrapperHelper(...): orchestrates calling JSToWasmWrapperAsm vs WasmReturnPromiseOnSuspendAsm based on promising mode; prepares wrapper buffer layout (JSToWasmWrapperFrameConstants offsets) and implicitArg; on entry may call runtime::TierUpJSToWasmWrapper to tier-up optimized wrapper. Anchors: 11-26, 497-772.
  - wasm-to-js.tq:
    • extern runtime TierUpWasmToJSWrapper(NoContext, WasmImportData): JSAny
    • transitioning macro WasmToJSWrapper(data: WasmImportData): WasmToJSResult { ... runtime::TierUpWasmToJSWrapper(kNoContext, data); }
  - builtins-definitions.h:
    • ASM/TFC registrations for: JSToWasmWrapperAsm, WasmReturnPromiseOnSuspendAsm, WasmToJsWrapperCSA, WasmToJsWrapperInvalidSig, WasmSuspend, etc., mapping to CodeKind: JS_TO_WASM_FUNCTION / WASM_TO_JS_FUNCTION.
- Role in pipeline:
  • Torque macros are used by generated JS builtins that run before or after TS-generated wrapper or assembly stubs, to trigger tiering and handle promise/suspender flows. The actual TS wrapper codegen is in wasm/wrappers.cc, while these torque files wire into JS-visible builtins and runtime tier-up.
explanation: Captures the Torque-layer glue for wrapper entry builtins and tier-up triggers, linking runtime functions and assembly stubs to the Turboshaft wrapper codegen path.
